releasenote-icon-fix-announcement:
## Icon System Setting Update

Due to a bug causing icons not to display correctly, we changed how custom bot icons are stored in version 2.5.0. As a result, you'll need to set your existing icons again. We apologize for the inconvenience.

You can set your icons in the Settings > Chatbots section for each bot.
releasenote-thinkmode-fix:
## Thinking Mode Improvements

We've made significant improvements to the thinking mode system:

- Fixed several display issues with thinking mode content
- Added better support for different AI models
- Improved performance for thinking tag processing across all bots
releasenote-remove-conversation-history:
## Conversation History Transfer Temporarily Removed

We've temporarily removed the conversation history transfer feature introduced in v2.5.0. Due to technical challenges, especially when conversations include images, this feature wasn't working as intended.

We're working on a more robust implementation and will reintroduce this feature in a future update.
releasenote-propaganda:
## Propaganda Feature Enhancement !!

Have you noticed the „Äåüì¢„Äç icon next to the copy button beside chat messages?

When you satisfied with one of AI answer, you can click „Äåüì¢„Äç icon and continue the converstaion with that response with all of AI chats

Check out [detailed video guide](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8y_T5vS1mBc) to learn how to use this feature and see it in action.
releasenote-code-expand:
## Code Expansion Feature

You want to see code bigger? You can do so by clicking the expand icon on the top right corner of the code block.
releasenote-claude3-7:
## Claude 3.7 Support

We've added support for the new Claude 3.7 Sonnet model. You can now use this model in both Claude API and Custom API settings.

Additionally, we've added the ability to manually enter custom model names for all API settings (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and Perplexity).
releasenote-model-suggestion-fix:
## Model Update Notification Fix
We've made a temporary fix for the issue where model update notifications couldn't be ignored. Currently, you cannot update models from the notification screen. Also, pressing the ignore button will prevent all model update notifications. We'll be improving this in future updates.
releasenote-claude-bedrock-thinking:
## Claude Bedrock Thinking Mode Support
When using Claude Bedrock API as a Custom Model, you can now enable the thinking mode.
This can be activated in the settings screen.
releasenote-thinking-mode:
## Improved Display of Plaintext Think Output (DeepSeek and Perplexity's thinking content now appears in thinking blocks)

We've implemented a framework that detects and extracts `<think>...</think>` tags from AI responses and displays them in thinking blocks.
- Improves readability for models like DeepSeek that return thinking content as plaintext in responses.
releasenote-conversation-history:
## Conversation History Transfer

You can now maintain conversation context when switching between different bots:

- Added an option to transfer history when switching bots in All-in-One mode (can be toggled in UI)
- Added a mode to chat with only one model in All-in-One mode.
releasenote-icon-system:
## Bot Icon System Overhaul

Bot icons are now properly maintained when reinstalling or importing/exporting settings from another PC:

- Implemented visual icon selection UI in the settings screen
releasenote-ui-improvements:
## UI Improvements

- **Single Model View**: Added a layout option to display only one model at a time
- **Better Bot Settings**: Reorganized detailed settings into collapsible panels
- **Bot Reordering**: Change custom bot order with up/down buttons
releasenote-api-template:
## Custom API Template Import

Easily import shared settings for AI chatbots, especially useful in enterprise environments where API configurations are provided by your company.
releasenote-claude-think:
## Claude API Enhancement

Added Thinking mode to Claude API (claude-think)
- New feature to visualize AI's thought process
- Added configurable thinking budget parameter (default 2000 tokens)
- Option to set different models for with/without thinking mode
releasenote-perplexity-reasoning:
## Perplexity Enhancement

- Added Reasoning mode to Perplexity API (perplexity-reasoning)
- Mode specialized for step-by-step reasoning process
- Ability to set different models for standard/reasoning modes
- Updated Perplexity logo design with 4 variations: Color, Mono, Sonar, Square
- Improved Claude API response handling
releasenote-gemini-2.5-pro:
## Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental Support

This release adds support for Google's new Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental model, offering a larger context window and enhanced reasoning capabilities. We've also fixed a bug where custom model names for Gemini API weren't saving correctly.

*(Fun fact: This release note was written by Gemini 2.5 Pro from diff with updated code!)*
releasenote-custom-claude-api:
## Custom Claude API Enhancements | Now Supporting Both Bedrock and Anthropic

### ÔΩûUp to 30% Performance Improvement with Anthropic's Official APIÔΩû

<video controls width="100%" style="max-width: 600px; margin: 20px auto; display: block; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);">
  <source src="videos/claude-anthropic-vs-bedrock.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

- Added API Provider selection in Advanced Settings (Choose from OpenAI Compatible, Anthropic Claude API, AWS Bedrock)
- Improved URL path handling to prevent duplication when API host already includes 'v1/'
- **Switching from Bedrock to Anthropic Claude API can improve response speed by 20-30%**

These changes make it easier to use Claude API with various service providers and custom endpoints while improving overall performance.
releasenote_v270_sidebar_all_in_one_fix: Fixed the "All-In-One" chat in the sidebar to always be displayed at the top.
releasenote_v270_thinking_mode_fix: Improved the display logic for "Thinking Mode" and "Temperature" settings, ensuring they appear more clearly based on the selected API provider.
releasenote_v270_add_model_button_enhanc: Added an "Add New Model" button to the bottom of the custom bot settings page for improved usability.
releasenote_v270_settings_bug_fix: Fixed a bug where changes made on the settings screen were sometimes not correctly reflected in the application settings.
releasenote_v270_omnibox_search:
## New: Search Directly from the Address Bar!

You can now launch HuddleLLM and send a chat query directly by typing `@hl` followed by your search keyword in the browser's address bar and pressing Enter.
For example, try typing `@hl Why does the war between Russia and Ukraine not end?` in the address bar and hit Enter.

<video controls width="100%" style="max-width: 600px; margin: 20px auto; display: block; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);">
  <source src="videos/HuddleLLM Addressbar search.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

settings_sorry_import_feature_is_not_wor: Import function may not work properly now. To ease managing the application code and fixing some defects, we recently updated the model config data structure. As a result, we also need to modify the import function, which takes some time. We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience.
